Major_Arcs.title: Nan and Cal in Ghost Town
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Nan's initial dissatisfaction with Ghost Town, her interactions with Cal, and the revelation of the town's impending demolition for an airport.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Discontent and Rejection
sub_scenes.description: Nan expresses her boredom and rejects Cal's advances, revealing her romanticized desires.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Rejection and the Ghost Town Mystery

sub_scenes.title: Departure and Airport Revelation
sub_scenes.description: Cal departs, and the arrival of men in a jeep reveals the plan to build an airport, devastating Nan.

narrative_arcs.title: Cal's Frustrated Departure from Ghost Town
Arrival at Merrick Gulch and the 'Ghost Town' Label
Airport Development Plans for the Ghost Town
Nan's Distress and Realization of Ghost Town's Demolition

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Airport Discussion
sub_scenes.description: Nan apologizes to Cal, and they discuss the airport's practicalities amidst emotional reflections and external confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Apology and Practical View of the Airport
Nan's Reflection on Her Harsh Reaction to Cal
Cal's Cynical Monologue on Love and Ghost Town
Confrontation with Rough Men and Nan's Resistance

sub_scenes.title: Family Conflict and Bedroom Reflection
sub_scenes.description: Nan faces dismissiveness from her father regarding the airport and engages in a heated argument, leading to emotional distress and reflection in her bedroom.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Airport Frustration and Father's Dismissiveness
Horses for Construction and Father-Daughter Argument
Nan's Humiliation and Reflection in Bed

sub_scenes.title: Advice and Pursuit of Truth
sub_scenes.description: Nan receives advice from her mother, father, and maid, prompting her to seek clarity about Cal's true feelings and act decisively.

narrative_arcs.title: Mother's Advice on Love and Childishness
Father's Pragmatic Advice to Focus on Cal
Maid's Reassurance of Cal's Love and Need for Patience
Nan's Resolve to Know Cal's True Feelings
Horses Arriving and Ranch Hand's Request for Help
Argument with Father About a Deal

Major_Arcs.title: Resolution and Weather Crisis
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc covers Nan and Cal's emotional resolution, the onset of a severe snowstorm impacting Ghost Town, and their community's response to the crisis.

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Resolution and Stampede
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal reconcile, confessing their feelings, but their moment is interrupted by a horse stampede and Cal's departure.

sub_scenes.title: Time Skip and Reunion
sub_scenes.description: A time skip narrates Nan's loneliness during Cal's absence, followed by Cal's return and belated confession.

sub_scenes.title: Snowstorm and Community Concern
sub_scenes.description: The narrative shifts to a severe snowstorm affecting Ghost Town, raising concerns about weather, stock, and community well-being.

sub_scenes.title: Despair and Hope
sub_scenes.description: Cal experiences despair, but hope arrives with a plane dropping fodder, leading to emotional resolution between Nan and Cal.

narrative_arcs.title: Hope from the Sky: Arrival of the Plane

Major_Arcs.title: Chane Benson's Confrontation and its Aftermath
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Chane Benson's violent confrontation, public skepticism towards his heroic image, and the ensuing conflict with Clyde Surrett and Jeff.

sub_scenes.title: Public Confrontation and Skepticism
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson is depicted in a public confrontation, followed by skeptical reactions and mockery from townspeople.

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Gun Obsession and Sister's Concern
sub_scenes.description: Sally expresses concern about Jeff's growing obsession with guns, leading to a confrontation when she finds him with their father's gun.

sub_scenes.title: Intervention and Ominous Advice
sub_scenes.description: Sally pleads with Jeff, and Clyde intervenes, followed by Sally introducing Mr. Benson, who gives ominous advice about Chane Benson.

narrative_arcs.title: Ominous Advice and Mention of Violence

sub_scenes.title: Public Opinion and Threats
sub_scenes.description: Public discussion about Chane Benson's reputation is fueled by an article in the Juniper Clarion, leading to a direct confrontation and threats against Clyde.

narrative_arcs.title: Public Discussion about Chane Benson's Reputation and Article
Confrontation and Warning in the Office

sub_scenes.title: Defiance and Danger
sub_scenes.description: Despite escalating threats and Sally's warnings, Clyde is determined to publish articles, leading to public reaction and a dinner invitation to Chane.

narrative_arcs.title: Clyde's Determination to Publish Articles Despite Threats
Public Reaction to Clyde's Articles and Jeff's Insight
Considering a Dinner Invitation for Chane Benson
Awkward Dinner and Jeff's Demonstration for Chane

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Aftermath and Sally's Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: The awkward dinner leads to a nighttime confrontation between Sally and Chane, and then Sally's angry confrontation with Jeff about betrayal.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Accusation and Chane's Evasive Response
Escalating Accusations and Threat of Violence
Sally's Confrontation with Jeff about Betrayal
Sally's Outburst and Accusation of Manipulation

sub_scenes.title: Climax and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: The conflict escalates with Chane asserting dominance, Sally reacting emotionally, and culminating in a confrontation with townsmen and Editor, leading to Chane's departure and a reflection on courage and decency.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Danger and Urgent Action
Confrontation with the Editor and Townsmen
Flashback to Clarion Office - The Ticking Clock
Flashback - Uncertainty and Fear Behind the Door
Reflection on Family, Courage, and Decency in Journalism

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy and Steve's Ranch Conflict and Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc covers Steve Daley's arrival at Betsy's ranch, the unfolding range war conflict, and the developing romantic relationship between Betsy and Steve amidst the danger.

sub_scenes.title: Arrival and Initial Distrust
sub_scenes.description: A physical confrontation sets the stage, followed by Steve Daley's introduction to Betsy, who expresses initial distrust despite his hiring.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley to Betsy
Confirmation of Hiring and Foreshadowing Trouble

sub_scenes.title: Settling In and Ranch Troubles
sub_scenes.description: Steve settles in as ranch troubles are revealed, and Betsy and Hank discuss Steve's character and the escalating conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Steve's Character and Past

sub_scenes.title: Journey to Town and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve travel to town, where Betsy faces a confrontation with Fred Bridges and his men, leading to a physical fight.

narrative_arcs.title: Journey to Town and Lingering Doubts
Leaving the Store and Betsy's Sarcasm
Aftermath of the Punch and Further Threat
Discussion on Gunfighters and Hornets' Nest

sub_scenes.title: Decision and Romantic Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Betsy reflects on Steve's gunfighter skills and orders him fired, then reconsiders, leading to a romantic confession and resolution as Steve agrees to give up his guns for her.

narrative_arcs.title: Hank's Understanding and Betsy's Romantic Feelings

Major_Arcs.title: Escalating Ranch Conflict and Climax at Devil's Pass
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc covers the escalating conflict with Old Man Bridges, Betsy and Steve's confrontation, and the dramatic climax and resolution at Devil's Pass.

sub_scenes.title: Land Dispute and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Old Man Bridges complains, leading to accusations and a tense confrontation between Betsy, Steve, and Hank regarding land and ranch ownership.

narrative_arcs.title: Old Man Bridges' Complaint and Hank's Accusation
Betsy and Steve's Confrontation and Steve's Challenge to Hank
Betsy's Stand Against Gun Violence and Concern for Steve
Steve's Reflection on Past Mistakes and the Ambush

sub_scenes.title: Action at Devil's Pass
sub_scenes.description: Betsy resolves to act, commanding her men to ride to Devil's Pass, leading to a confrontation and climax at that location.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy and Steve's Parting and Betsy's Worried Reflection
Betsy's Command and Ride to Devil's Pass
Arrival at Devil's Pass and Ominous Recognition

sub_scenes.title: Resolution at Devil's Pass
sub_scenes.description: Betsy recovers at Devil's Pass, and shares an emotional reunion with Steve, solidifying their relationship and future.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Recovery and Reassurance by Steve

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie, Fred, and Dave's Romantic Entanglements
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Carrie's complex romantic relationships with Fred and Dave, culminating in her realization of Fred's deceit and her ultimate choice.

sub_scenes.title: Protecting Dave and Range Conflict
sub_scenes.description: Carrie argues to protect Dave, followed by the introduction of a range conflict and Fred Gordon's arrival.

narrative_arcs.title: Curley's Troubled Arrival and Range Conflict

sub_scenes.title: Fence Dispute and Gun Draw
sub_scenes.description: The rancher explains the fence necessity, leading to Fred Gordon's tense arrival and a gun being drawn, escalating the range conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Explaining the Fence and Herd Concerns
Fred Gordon's Polite but Tense Arrival

sub_scenes.title: Past Apology and Conflicted Feelings
sub_scenes.description: Flashback to a past apology to Fred Gordon, contrasted with Carrie and Dave's present conflicted feelings about Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie and Dave's Conflicted Feelings about Fred
Present Confrontation: Fred Gordon and Carrie

sub_scenes.title: Accusation, Confession, and Proposal
sub_scenes.description: Fred accuses Carrie, Dave intervenes, leading to Carrie's confession and a romantic flashback proposal from Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie's Confession and Dave's Attempt to Reconcile

sub_scenes.title: Deceit and Determination
sub_scenes.description: Fred's contract-driven proposal is revealed, leading to Carrie's anger, rejection of Dave, and determination to confront Mr. Carlton.

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Resolution with Carlton
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts Mr. Carlton, leading to a resolution where Carrie secures her ranch independently, and Fred's manipulative plan backfires.

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Closure
sub_scenes.description: Carrie finds emotional comfort in her father's arms, and he offers wisdom about love and life, providing closure to her emotional turmoil.

narrative_arcs.title: Father's Wisdom on Love and Life

sub_scenes.title: Reflection and Final Choice
sub_scenes.description: Carrie reflects on Fred and encounters Dave in town, leading to her declaration of love for Fred and abrupt departure to act on her feelings, culminating in a romantic reunion and proposal.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie's Relief and Reflection on Fred
Mr. Carlton's Arrival and Carrie's Misinterpretation
Revelation of Fred's Sacrifice and Brother's Intervention
Carrie's Emotional Awakening and Ride to Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk and Rance's Conflict and Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers on Dirk's return, his conflict with Marshal Rance Cready, and their ultimate resolution, intertwined with Chris's love and intervention.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Return and Injury Reveal
sub_scenes.description: Dirk's dramatic return is followed by the revelation of his gunshot injury and his sister's concern.

sub_scenes.title: Investigation and Marshal's Arrival
sub_scenes.description: Dad plans to investigate Dirk's situation, while Marshal Rance Cready arrives at the ranch, beginning his inquiry.

narrative_arcs.title: Marshal Rance Cready's Arrival and Initial Inquiry
Confirmation of Pursuit and Denial of Dirk's Presence
Rance Cready's Insistence and Proof of Dirk's Presence

sub_scenes.title: Compromise and Reunion
sub_scenes.description: Marshal Cready finds Dirk and agrees to a delay for his recovery, leading to a reunion and emotional exchange between Chris and Rance.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern for Injured Dirk and Assertion of Law
Rejection of Excuse and Acknowledgment of Change
Argument, Confession and Confirmation of Love
Rance's Internal Conflict and Realization of Misjudgment
Rance's Decision, Departure Announcement and Realization of Manipulation

sub_scenes.title: Escape and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Concern about the Marshal leads to an escape attempt, a failed evasion, and a violent confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern about the Marshal and Reassurance
Realization of Pursuit and Urgent Escape
Argument on Handling the Injured Person
Forced Departure and Concern for the Injured
Woman's Reflection and Understanding of Love for Rance
Return to Rance and Confrontation about Injury

sub_scenes.title: Recovery and Wedding Interruption
sub_scenes.description: Rance recovers, leading to a marriage proposal from Chris, but their wedding is dramatically interrupted by Dirk's arrival and the Marshal's presence, which is resolved by Dirk's brother's explanation.

narrative_arcs.title: Father's Departure and Hint at Private Matters
Expression of Gratitude and Love Confession
Rance's Reflections on Marriage and Dirk
